alert.note: Alert for Coleman; Concho; Mason; McCulloch; Menard; Schleicher; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 12:09AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Schleicher, southwestern Coleman, southeastern Tom Green, western McCulloch, Menard, northwestern Mason and Concho Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1209 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Live Oak, or 16 miles north of Fort Mckavett, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Menard, Eden, Melvin, Lohn, Rockwood, Waldrip, Calf Creek, Pear Valley, Doole, Stacy, Salt Gap, Hext, Millersview, Fort Mckavett, Live Oak, Fife, Camp Sol Mayer, Vick, The Intersection Of Us- 190 And Ranch Road 1311 and Us-83 Near The Menard- Concho County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Coleman; Concho; Mason; McCulloch; Menard; Schleicher; Tom Green
